characters: HIM TO THE CREATURE IN THE ICY POD
INCLUDE CASSIDY AND THE OTHER PANEL MEMBERS
INCLUDE THE MAN FROM THE BAR
TO A MAN AT THE END OF THE BAR
CAMERA LANDING ON ASSISTANT DIRECTOR JANA CASSIDY
OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE BALCONY PASSAGEWAY
CAMERA RISING UP A FROSTY WALL OF BLUE ICE
OPPOSITE PERIMETER OF THE FIELD OF CORN
SUNSHINE BREAKS THROUGH THE ROOF OF THE CAVE
OVER THE TECHNICIANS TO BRONSCHWEIG DOWN BELOW
LOW WITH A PAIR OF FEET
THE BODY IN THE MELTING ICE LITH
THE BOOTH WHERE HE MET KURTZWEIL EARLIER
CAMERA SLOWLY RISING UP FROM STEVIE'S SHOES
TIGHT CSM AT INT. KENSINGTON BUILDING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINDING WHITE SCREEN, under which we hear an ominous low end Dolby THX Big Screen rumble. We're not in 19" television land anymore, Toto. As the rumble builds, TWO BLACK FIGURES appear on what now has resolved into a distant horizon. From their movements we can shortly see that the figures are men. Moving along a windswept ice sheet in an otherwise featureless land. A LEGEND appears: NORTH TEXAS, 35,000 B.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuing toward us, we can now see that they are dressed in crude garments made of animal skins. If we squint we can see their hair is long, their jutting foreheads significant of primitive Homo Sapiens. They continue toward us, the wind beating against them, CAMERA IS CRANING DOWN to the snow that lies before them. To LARGE THREE-TOED TRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING THE PRIMITIVES
dialogues.text: As they track the three-toed prints to a rocky crevice in the hard-pack ice. The prints stop here, and so do the men. Dropping down into the crevice in pursuit of their quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark in here, except where the sunlight penetrates the thick, glassy ice walls. The silhouettes of the Primitives stark against the glistening cavern. The sound of flint being struck, then A TORCH CATCHES FIRE, illuminating their faces. And:

dialogues.speaker: A CREATURE
dialogues.text: Deeper in the cave. Fleeing the light and the men. We get only a brief glimpse of it in the torch light, seeing that it moves upright on two legs and has gray, dinosaur-like skin. And large black eyes. But it moves quickly enough away that any other identifying feature is lost in the deeper shadows.

dialogues.speaker: THE PRIMITIVES
dialogues.text: Removing crude weapons made of sharpened bone from under their thick fur garments, and scrabbling into the constricting cavern, giving chase. Following them as they moves with animal-like agility through the tightening space. Predatory hunters. Their torchlight catching:

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: As it disappears into a tight opening in a smaller crevice leading off the main one. The Primitives entering frame after a moment, only a few steps behind. The LEAD PRIMITIVE dropping to the cave floor, pulling himself into this same tight fissure in pursuit. Splitting off from his partner who exits frame still on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fiery torch comes through first, held by the lead man. Throwing dancing shadows on the walls of what appears to be a box cavern.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PRIMITIVE
dialogues.text: Rising quickly to his feet. Not seeing what the torch illuminates just behind him: The face of a dead Primitive Man, his body frozen into the ice. He does finally notice this, turning to see it, when he's ATTACKED VICIOUSLY FROM BEHIND. The torch falls to the floor so that the fight is difficult to see, but it is loud and cruel. The creature squealing wildly as the grunts of the Primitive now turn to the sounds of painful struggle. Until:

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND PRIMITIVE MAN
dialogues.text: Suddenly appears, driving his bone weapon into the body of the Creature. Again and again, until the Creature is driven away into the shadows. The Second Man grabs the torch now, not to see if his hunting mate has survived, but in pursuit of the Creature. In the light we see that he and his weapon are covered with spatters of OILY BLACK BLOOD. As is the First Primitive whose body lies heaving on the floor. The Second Primitive stepping over his hunting mate, stalking the Creature into the shadows, where it has collapsed. The torch finally landing, for the first time, on its face. When the torchlight hits its face, the Creature attacks. But the Primitive prevails. He drops his torch and dispatches the already wounded Creature with strong hard stabs of his weapon, one of which penetrates the Creature's eye.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD CREATURE
dialogues.text: The torch, which lies on the ground, illuminates the dead creature's face. Its wounds are flowing with the oily black blood, which, oddly now, BEGINS TO POOL. As if it has intelligence, sentience. Pooling and traveling into a fissure in the cave floor. And disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND PRIMITIVE
dialogues.text: Watching this, unknowing. His chest heaving from the fight, as the spots of Oily Black Blood which have spattered onto him begin to crawl. Crawling toward his eyes and mouth. Causing him to let out grunts of fear. Which are the sounds we hear as the CAMERA SLOWLY CRANES UP past the struggling Primitive to the roof of the cave, where the dancing shadows of the torch FADE AWAY with the sounds of struggle. Moving into darkness and silence. But only for a moment. Until:

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Along with the spade of a shovel. And then -- the earthen cave ceiling gives way and A BOY wearing Nikes and an old t-shirt falls through it. Falling PAST CAMERA. We hear a YELL, then a THUD, and a CLATTERING of the shovel that's fallen in with him. Then a pained GASPING. Then SEVERAL HEADS appear in the opening. These are BOYS of ten to eleven, staring down into the cave. Hot sunlight blazing in. We have traveled far, far forward in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stevie. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: On the floor below covered with dirt, in his nose and mouth. Spitting out. (All these boys have Texas in their voices.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got...I got....I got.... (straining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....the wind knocked out of me. This draws no sympathy from above, only LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS UP ABOVE
dialogues.text: Staring excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a cave or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's down there, Stevie? Anything?

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE BOYS ABOVE
dialogues.text: Stevie has gotten up, moving out of the patch of sunlight. Disappearing from view for a moment. Then reappearing, still spitting out dirt. But holding:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human skull. One side partially missing from the cranium. But it brings WHOOPS of delight from the boys above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss it up here, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, buttwipe. I found it. It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other boys looking down at him. Stevie looking at the skull. Strangely, the light shines through it. It is milky, opaque, as if it's bone that's turned somehow glassy in places. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyways, there's bones all over the place down here. Stevie looks down at his feet. CAMERA FOLLOWING HIS LOOK DOWN to where there are indeed more human bones. And something else. He takes a couple of steps in place, standing in a familiar BLACK, OILY substance -- which is climbing up his tennis shoe from the rock floor, over the edge of the shoe and down into the shoe itself. Then the SKULL drops in the frame, clattering on the hard floor of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA SLOWLY RISING UP FROM STEVIE'S SHOES
dialogues.text: Following SUBCUTANEOUS WORMS which have begun locomoting aggressively up his legs. As his whole body is WRACKED by a shivering seizure of some kind. CAMERA RISES, following the path of the worms as they move up the legs of his shorts. Some appearing on his bare arms, but the great majority continuing up to Stevie's neck, toward his face. Stevie stands paralyzed. Letting out guttural sounds not dissimilar to when the wind was knocked out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stevie.... But Stevie cannot answer him. CAMERA CONTINUING UP to the boys above. Looking down at their friend. Their eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? But what they see next answers that question for them.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: His face suddenly alive with the subcutaneous worms. Moving toward his eyes which begin filling with BLACK OIL. Looking much now like ALIEN EYES.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS ABOVE
dialogues.text: Freaked by what they see. And doing what any kid would do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man. Let's get outta here. And they do. Bolting from the hole in the top of the cave. CAMERA PUSHING UP THROUGH THIS HOLE to REVEAL we are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dirt hole that was being dug by the three kids. RISING UP out of the hole to REVEAL the parched dirt patch where THREE KIDS are running away from us, as fast as their feet will take them. Toward A NEW HOUSING TRACT (five floorplans to choose from, including the model home.) Disappearing into the neighborhood. A LEGEND appears: NORTH TEXAS, 1998. CAMERA CONTINUES RISING ABOVE THE ROOFTOPS to see the surrounding expanse of empty Texas flatland. And in the distance, the DALLAS SKYLINE. As CAMERA SETTLES, there are a few moments of nothing but the sound of the wind gently whistling across the landscape. In which we bury a short TIME CUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we HEAR it, before we see it: FIRE ENGINES pulling into the neighborhood, sirens WAILING. CAMERA DROPPING AGAIN as the lead engine pulls up. FIREMEN are hopping off, moving to the hole the boys dug.

dialogues.speaker: HOLE
dialogues.text: TWO firemen carrying a ladder clamber down PAST CAMERA, THREE OTHERS appearing on their heels. The other two firemen clamber down, too. THE CAPTAIN at the edge of the hole watching them. Holding a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Miles Cooles...we've got a rescue situation in progress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the LEAD FIREMAN steps down the ladder into the cave. He scans the darkness, illuminated only by the shaft of light permitted by the hole above. As the 2ND FIREMAN drops down next to him. The both stand motionless now, as if sensing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie's feet are just visible on the floor of the cave, a short distance away.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME FIREMEN
dialogues.text: They start cautiously toward Stevie. CAMERA FINDING their feet. Tracking through the same OILY, BLACK SUBSTANCE we saw bleeding from the creature thirty five thousand years ago. As they move into the shadows, we HOLD ON THE SUBSTANCE....and see it MOVE. It's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA RISES out of the dirt hole, finds A GROUP OF

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBORS
dialogues.text: Concerned PARENTS, KIDS, including Stevie's friends. They're held at a distance by the remaining firemen. Everyone turning their concerned gazes skyward. Looking at:

dialogues.speaker: A MED-EVAC CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Coming off the sun-setting horizon. Moving toward us at high speed. The WHOP, WHOP of its blade soon shaking the neighborhood as it banks in and around and hovers just over the dirt field. Landing gently on the parched hard scrabble. The side door flies open and FIVE HAZ-MAT RESCUE PARAMEDICS jump out carrying a bubble litter. CAMERA PANS THEM to the dirt hole past THE FIRE CAPTAIN. The Haz-Mat Paramedics moving down into the hole. The Fire Captain watches this, then stares toward -- DR. BEN BRONSCHWEIG (in shirtsleeves, tie), exiting the chopper, following up the rear. The Captain meeting him in route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the chopper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep those people back. Get them out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move them all back. (dogging Bronschweig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent four men down after the boy. They're not responding. Dr. Bronschweig's focus is elsewhere, though. He's making a bee line to the earthen hole where young Stevie is being pulled out and lifted into an enclosed QUARANTINE BUBBLE LITTER by the rescue squad. Bronschweig watches with great concern. Getting a good look now at Stevie's paralyzed body as it passes him.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER
dialogues.text: As Stevie's body is loaded aboard, the side door is slid shut. The engine throttles up and the chopper takes flight again, almost as quickly as it arrived. The prop wash blowing:

dialogues.speaker: DR. BRONSCHWEIG
dialogues.text: And the gathering crowd. Bronschweig watches the chopper bank away, then turns his look to:

dialogues.speaker: THE NEIGHBORHOOD
dialogues.text: Where A SERIES OF UNMARKED CARGO VANS, TRUCKS are rolling in. A fleet of vehicles, driven by what looks like MILITARY PERSONNEL. Most conspicuously TWO WHITE UNMARKED TANKER TRUCKS. (There are NO MARKINGS on these vehicles.)

dialogues.speaker: RESUME BRONSCHWEIG
dialogues.text: As the Fire Captain moves around to face him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brusquely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing all we can. And he moves off toward the approaching trucks where the MILITARY PERSONNEL are pulling out tents, tent poles, scientific equipment. Leaving the Captain to wonder what the hell's going on. Watching the first of many REFRIGERATION UNITS being unloaded. The personnel carrying it paying him no mind as they blow past him. Moving RIGHT TO CAMERA and plunging us into BLACK. HOLD. Then OVER BLACK, a familiar sound again. The sound of a chopper auguring in. As we FADE UP, revealing we are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper is banking over the side of the building, preparing to touch down on the rooftop where FIFTEEN FBI AGENTS in dark ID windbreakers are standing. A LEGEND appears: FEDERAL BUILDING, DALLAS, TEXAS. ONE WEEK LATER. The chopper touches down and, again, the side door is thrown open. But now only one man exits: SPECIAL AGENT IN CHARGE (S.A.C.) DARIUS MICHAUD. Michaud moves with the measured pace of authority, approaching the waiting FBI Agents. One of whom steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've evacuated the building and been through it bottom to top. No trace of an explosive device or anything resembling one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you taken the dogs through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, take them through again. This is given as a non-negotiable order, to the somewhat weary FBI man. Who turns back to his charges, Michaud does not register this attitude, though. Something else has caught his attention. Causing him to walk to the edge of the building. CAMERA FOLLOWING HIM, seeing what he sees now. On an adjacent skyscraper is what appears to be AN FBI AGENT in an ID windbreaker exiting onto the roof. CAMERA CONTINUING AROUND into A CLOSE UP PROFILE of S.A.C Michaud. Staring at this, his jaw set. He doesn't like what he sees. And what he sees is:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agent Dana Scully is coming out the door leading onto the roof. The door slams shut behind her. She, too, is dressed in an FBI windbreaker. She's dialing her cell phone as she moves around the rooftop looking for something. Dialing the number of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder -- it's me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Scully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Scully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just climbed twelve floors. I'm hot and thirsty and I'm wondering, to be honest, what I'm doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking for a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. But the threat was called in for the Federal Building across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they have that covered. WE ARE TRACKING WITH SCULLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder... when a terrorist bomb threat is called in, the logical purpose of providing this information is to allow us to find the bomb. The rational object of terrorism is to promote terror. If you'd study model behavioral pattern in virtually every case where a threat has turned up an explosive device. If we don't act in accordance with that data -- if you ignore it as we have done -- the chances are great that if here actually is a bomb we might not find it. Lives could be lost -- Scully, engrossed in her own argument, realizes she's been the only one speaking for the last short while. She stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to playing a hunch? Scully almost JUMPS out of her own skin. The voice has come not over the phone, but from two feet away where:

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE AGENT MULDER
dialogues.text: Standing in the shadow of a large air conditioning unit. Cracking a trademark sunflower seed between his teeth. Clicking his cell phone off. Moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Mulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The element of surprise, Scully. Random acts of unpredictability. If we fail to anticipate the unforeseen or expect the unexpected in a universe of infinite possibilities, we find ourselves at the mercy of anyone or anything that cannot be programmed, categorized or easily referenced... Mulder has moved to the edge of the building where he sails his sunflower seeds into the air. Dusting his hands off as if lost in a wistful through for just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing up here? It's hotter than hell. And he's on the move. Scully moving to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder is moving toward the stairs, Scully catching him. Mulder allowing her to lead him up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're bored in this assignment, but unconventional thinking is only going to get you into trouble now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to quit looking for what isn't there. They've closed the X-Files. There's procedure to be followed here. Protocol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we call in a bomb threat for Houston. I think it's free beer night at the Astrodome. Scully gives him a look. It's no use. She reaches the door first, grabs the knob but... it won't open. Turning to Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked? She wiggles the knob again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for anticipating the unforeseen... Scully squints into the sun, staring at Mulder. But he's quick on the draw, and realizes what she's up to. He grabs for the door and... it opens. Looking to Scully whose hard look of mock-scolding has become a smirking smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Had you big time. And that's how it continues as they re-enter the stairwell, the door slamming shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an elevator DINGS and the doors open. Scully and Mulder exit into the lobby where people move in and out. Heads turn due to their FBI jackets. (Included atmosphere: a GROUP OF KIDS on a field trip, being led into an elevator by THEIR TEACHER.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your face, Mulder. There was a moment of panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic? Have you ever seen me panic, Scully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did. You're buying. Mulder fishes for change, but more out of sportsmanship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... what'll it be: Coke, Pepsi? A saline IV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something sweet. Scully flashes a thin victory smile, as Mulder heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder moving to a door with a small shingle above it which says SNACKS/BEVERAGES. As he approaches, sorting through the change he's fished up, the door opens and A MAN IN A VENDOR'S UNIFORM appears. He makes casual and ever-so-brief eye contact with Mulder as he brushes past him. Mulder making no note of this as he moves to catch the door before it closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder takes a few steps down into the windowless room. Moving past the snack machines to a LIGHTED soda machine. Finding the correct change and plunking it in. Hitting a button, but... nothing comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. He beats his fist a couple of times on the front of the machine. Nothing. He finds more change. Plunking it in. Hits the button. Nothing. He stares at the machine a minute, then BEATS IT HARD with his fist. Nothing. Moving around to the back of the machine, looking for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder's face peering in on the slim space between the machine and the wall. Reaching down and lifting the PLUG on the end of the electrical cord. It isn't plugged in. Realizing now why the machine hasn't spit out his sodas.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE
dialogues.text: As Mulder appears, stepping very lightly in front of the machine that he was just pounding away on. Looking at it, then moving quickly to the door he entered through. Grasping the knob, but finding it... LOCKED. He jiggles the knob, pulls on it. But there's no two ways about it, he's locked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully stands looking at her watch. Wondering where Mulder is. When her CELL PHONE starts ringing. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully, I found the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks he's joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Mulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the vending room. Scully is on the move, but she doesn't believe him for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully appears, heard A POUNDING. Following this noise to the door Mulder is obviously on the other side of. Tries the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you pounding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder holds his phone to his ear, using his other hand to pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully, get somebody to open this door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try, Mulder. CAMERA FOLLOWING MULDER as he steps back, revealing now that he's gotten the hinged front of the coke machine open. But we can't yet see what's inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully -- listen to me. It's in the coke machine. You've got about fourteen minutes to get this building evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully is shaking her head. Tries the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Open the door. His response to this is MORE HARD POUNDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder? Tell me this is a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen fifty nine, thirteen fifty eight, thirteen fifty seven... As he is doing this, Scully is bending to see:

dialogues.speaker: THE KEYHOLE
dialogues.text: It's been freshly soldered over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder stands pacing in front of:

dialogues.speaker: AN ELABORATELY ENGINEERED EXPLOSIVE DEVICE
dialogues.text: Wired with circuit boards, electric belts and generally looking like it would take an expert a good long time to figure out where to even start. A lot longer than the 13:58 that reads on the digital read-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thirteen fifty six...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. I'm gonna get you out of there. The line goes dead. And off Mulder's deepening anxiety, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully enters like General Patton, taking charge. Barking at the security guards who sit behind their security console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need this building evacuated and cleared out in ten minutes! I need you to get on the phone and tell the fire department to block off the city center in one mile radius around the building --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In ten minutes.....?!

dialogues.speaker: AND MAKE IT HAPPEN
dialogues.text: And she's moving, dialing her cell phone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Special Agent Dana Scully. I need to speak to S.A.C. Michaud. He's got the wrong building --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNMARKED FBI VANS, CARS are pulling up out front. Agents in windbreakers are exiting, moving at a run to the building. Among them S.A.C. Darius Michaud. Moving to:

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: Exiting the building. Behind her, WORKERS are beginning to stream out of the building, as well as the young FIELD TRIPPERS. Michaud meeting up with Scully mid-plaza. As the windbreaker Agents move past them, entering the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? MOVING WITH THEM now, back toward the building. As FIRE TRUCKS are pulling up out in the street out front. Suddenly this has the distinct feel of a situation veering out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder found it in a vending machine. He's locked in with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DIGITAL READ OUT hits 7:00. Pull back to REVEAL MULDER staring at it. If he wasn't sweating enough on the roof, he's certainly sweating now. When his cell phone RINGS. Answering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder. Move away from the door. We're coming through it. No sooner is this said than the CAMERA WHIPS OFF MULDER to the door, where A GAS PLASMA TORCH FLAME is sizzling along the hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Michaud himself, wearing a Kevlar vest now, is wielding the torch. Expertly cutting the metal while Scully and TWO AGENTS and TWO DALLAS BOMB SQUAD men look on. In the b.g. BUILDING EMPLOYEES are streaming out. Michaud finishes and shuts off the torch. Yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. The other Agents kick the metal door in sending it crashing to the floor. Mulder stands on the other side. Watching Michaud pick up a heft tool kit, stepping over the downed door. Scully right behind him. Along with the Agents, Bomb techs.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER AND THE SODA MACHINE/BOMB
dialogues.text: As Michaud steps in next to him, sizing up the time on the ticking digital readout: 4:07. And just exactly what kind of defusing work he's got cut out for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this is just soda pop in those canisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's what it looks like. A big I.E.D. - ten gallons of astrolite. (studying the bomb)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get everybody out of here and clear the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's got to stay with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you an order. Now get the hell out of here and evacuate the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you defuse it? Setting his tool kit down, opening it. As the other Agents heed his word, exiting the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got about four minutes to find out if you're wrong. Michaud turns on him with unexpected intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Mulder. Scully starts out. Mulder stares at Michaud for a moment, but Michaud's focus is on the bomb now. He won't meet Mulder's look. Finally Mulder moves off, following Scully. CAMERA HOLDS ON MICHAUD, just staring at the bomb. Just staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the building occupants are being hauled off in CITY BUSES which have moved in curbside. As these buses pull away, so do the fire trucks that have positioned themselves out front. And the police squad cars. As Mulder and Scully exit the front door. Moving quickly, until Mulder hits mid-plaza and slows. Scully not realizing this for a few steps, then turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? (off his non-response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder -- One last windbreakered Agent is exiting. Moving past them to the last cop car other than the car waiting for Mulder and Scully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear. Mulder has stopped and is looking back to the building now as Scully hustles back the few steps separating them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: THEM TO THE WAITING CAR
dialogues.text: As the Last Agent Out's car zooms away. Leaving only their car and the man driving it: a WINDBREAKERED AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing? The plaza is desolate now, void of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's not right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mulder! Get in the car! Scully is pulling him now. Pulling him toward the car and the obviously impatient Windbreakered Agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BOMB. The seconds ticking off now, as it passes the :30 mark. CAMERA PULLING BACK, ADJUSTING to Michaud. His tool chest is closed up, and he is sitting on it improbably. Still staring at the bomb, then pulling his head down in what appears to be resignation. As the seconds tick away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder has relented now, against his better instincts. Moving with Scully to the car, faster as they go. The Windbreaker Agent standing in the open door of the driver's side. Getting in behind the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: S.A.C. MICHAUD
dialogues.text: Sitting motionless in front of the bomb as the seconds tick down. 8-7-6-5-4-3-2-1- --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder and Scully getting in the car. TRACKING BACKWARDS with them now as the Agent driving pulls away, getting only thirty, maybe forty yards when: the BOMB DETONATES and the building EXPLODES. And this is no fatwa symbolic little terror strike. This is Oklahoma City. Or do we say, Independence Day.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: As all the windows blow out and the car is lifted up, slamming into the corner of a parked car. The air so quickly full of debris that it would seem the whole city has been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME BUILDING
dialogues.text: As the debris starts to clear somewhat, much of it still floating to the ground, though. We see the fires raging on every floor. That most of the front of the building has been torn away and we can see right into many floors.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Where it sits half cocked against a parked car. The air is full of debris, particulated matter. The rear door of the squad car opens now and Mulder gets out, covered with glass. Moving to the front passenger door, opening it for Scully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with darkest irony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time you're buying.

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON D.C.
dialogues.text: HIGH ABOVE the U.S. capital, the entire beltway. With a LEGEND, to establish.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER AND TIGHTER NOW
dialogues.text: On the J. Edgar Hoover Building, FBI Headquarters. Descending low on the three-sided monolith and its large interior courtyard. As another LEGEND appears, under:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In light of Waco, and Ruby Ridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formal hearing. Several ASSISTANT DIRECTORS sit at a head table, going over documents. NAME PLACECARDS in front of them. PANNING the group, the sound of papers shuffling, the occasional clearing of a throat creating a stale air of importance, under:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there is a heightened need at the Attorney General's office to place responsibility as early as possible.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA LANDING ON ASSISTANT DIRECTOR JANA CASSIDY
dialogues.text: A no-nonsense 40 year-old lawyer cum FBI Agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for the catastrophic destruction of public property and the loss of life due to terrorist activities... Next to Cassidy is Assistant Director WALTER SKINNER, Mulder and Scully's former superior on the X-Files. Looking ruefully at:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCULLY
dialogues.text: At a small table, the chair next to her conspicuously empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many details are still unclear; some agents' reports have not been filed, or have come in sketchy, without a satisfactory accounting of the events that led to the destruction in Dallas. But we're under some pressure to give an accurate picture of what happened to the Attorney General, so she can issue a public statement. The door to the room opens behind Scully now, and Mulder enters, his manner that of a man who knows he's late to a function.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME A.D. CASSIDY
dialogues.text: She looks up at Mulder and Scully with a stern glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now know that five people died in the explosion. Special Agent in Charge Darius Michaud who was trying to defuse the bomb that had been hidden in a vending machine. Three firemen from Dallas, and a young boy.

dialogues.speaker: OVER MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: Mulder pulls out his chair to sit down, but remains standing. They trade a look. This is new news to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- the firemen and the boy -- they were in the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder, since you weren't able to be on time for this hearing, I'm going to ask you to step outside so that we can get Agent Scully's version of the facts. So that she won't have to be paid the same disrespect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were told the building was clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get your turn, Agent Mulder. Please step out. Mulder trades looks with:

dialogues.speaker: A.D. SKINNER
dialogues.text: Who stares at him evenly, but not unsympathetically. He's been here with Mulder on many occasions. Seen Mulder run up against the Bureau and its stiff conventions. Always in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does say there in your paperwork that we were the ones who found the bomb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Agent Mulder. We'll call you in shortly.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER, SCULLY
dialogues.text: As Mulder slides his chair in. Scully watching him exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder sits by himself in a chair, head down. When the door to the hearing room opens. Mulder rising as A.D. Skinner exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, they're still talking to Agent Scully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They're asking her for a narrative. They want to know why she was in the wrong building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was with me. Skinner studies Mulder, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't see what's going on here, do you? (off Mulder's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's four hundred million dollars in damage to the city of Dallas. Lives have been lost. No suspects have been named. So the story being shaped is this could have been prevented. That the FBI didn't do its job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they want to blame us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder -- we both know that if you and Agent Scully hadn't taken the initiative to search the adjacent building, you could have multiplied the fatalities by a hundred --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping the irony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not the lives we saved. It's the lives we didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reciting the dictum)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- if it looks bad, it's bad for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- if they want someone to blame, they can blame me. Agent Scully doesn't deserve this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in there right now saying the same thing about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I breached protocol. I broke contact with the S.A.C. I ignored a primary tactical rule and left him alone with the device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Scully says it was she who ordered you out of the building. That you wanted to go back. Mulder doesn't get to respond, because the door opens again and Agent Scully exits. She looks like she's been through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Skinner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're asking for you, Sir. Skinner gives one last look to Mulder, then re-enters. Leaving Mulder and Scully alone. Scully wearing a pained look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you told them in there, you don't have to protect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I told them was the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to divide us on this, Scully. We can't let them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have divided us, Mulder. They're splitting us up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meet with the OPR day after tomorrow for remediation and reassignment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you must have an idea. They cited a history of problems relating back to 1993.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were the ones that put us together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they wanted me to invalidate your work, your investigations into the paranormal. But I think this goes deeper than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about you, Scully. They're doing this to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not doing this, Mulder. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left behind a career in medicine because I thought I might make a difference at the FBI. When they recruited me they told me women made up nine percent of the bureau. I felt this was not an impediment, but an opportunity to distinguish myself. But it hasn't turned out that way. And now, if I were to be transferred to Omaha, or Wichita or some field office where I'm sure I could rise, it just doesn't hold the interest for me it once did. Not after what I've seen and done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... quitting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's really no reason left for me to stay anymore. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should ask yourself if your heart's still in it, too. The door opens to the hearing room again now. A.D. Skinner steps part way out, gesturing to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder. You're up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regretfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Good luck. Mulder rises. Scully studying his poorly disguised hurt. Before he turns and goes into the room. Scully watching the door close behind him. Her feelings poorly disguised, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SHOOTER OF TEQUILA being poured. CAMERA ADJUSTING to reveal the ATTRACTIVE BARMAID tipping the bottle. Pushing it across the bar to where TWO EMPTY SHOOTERS sit, making the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say this about exceeds your minimum daily requirement. The person she's talking to us:

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: He sits by himself on a stool, staring down at the bar. Staring at the shooter which he spins with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta train for this kind of heavy lifting. Mulder tosses back the shooter anyway. She watches him as she retrieves the small shot glass, intrigued by his dark silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poopy day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman? (Mulder shakes his head no)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work. Mulder nods, pointing to the tequila bottle again. The Barmaid agrees to pour another one, reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: TO A MAN AT THE END OF THE BAR
dialogues.text: Staring at Mulder intently. He's older than Mulder, dressed in an old Brooke Brothers light summer suit. Mulder notices him, feels his gaze, but doesn't give it thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do. (off her curious look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a key figure in an ongoing government charade. An annoyance to my superiors. A joke among my peers. "Spooky," they call me. Spooky Mulder. Whose sister was abducted by aliens when he was a kid. Who now chases little green men with a badge and a gun, shouting to the heavens and anyone who'll listen that the fix is in. That our government's hip to the truth and a part of the conspiracy. That the sky is falling and when it hits it's gonna be the shitstorm of all time. She stares at him for a moment, startled by his drunken screed. She pulls back the shooter she's just poured Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that about does it, Spooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go home to the old lady

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Don't have one. Mulder slides off his stool, noticing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Watchful Man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER
dialogues.text: He feints toward the door, then reverses direction. Heads to the back of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder appears, moving to the bathroom door. Only to find an OUT OF ORDER sign on it. He moves to the woman's room, but it's locked. Gathering what's left of his wits, Mulder does what any red-blooded man would do in this situation. He goes to the back door of the bar and exits into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder has found a place against a wall, between two dumpsters. Jerking around in surprise at the sound of a VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That official FBI business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE THE MAN FROM THE BAR
dialogues.text: He's not far from Mulder. His name is KURTZWEIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet the Bureau's accusing you of the same thing in Dallas. Mulder's weirded out as the stranger moves to him un- threateningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing around holding your yank while bombs are exploding. Kurtzweil enjoys a little laugh over this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've been watching your career for a good while. Back when you were just a promising young agent -- before that. Mulder stares at this man as he finishes, zipping up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You follow me out here for a reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. Kurtzweil unzips his own pants now. There is a moment; one of those awkward moments where Mulder's not sure what's about to happen. But Kurtzweil's just relieving himself, too. Shuffling up to the wall, Mulder takes this as an opportunity to head back toward the bar. But Kurtzweil hails him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Kurtzweil. Dr. Alvin Kurtzweil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the name. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old friend of your father's. Kurtzweil continues peeing. Knows this got Mulder's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the Department of State. We were what you might call fellow travelers, but his disenchantment outlasted mine. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never believed in the Project. Mulder stares at Kurtzweil now. He's being toyed with. He turns, opens the door into the bar. As Kurtzweil gets a little louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Don't pretend you don't know about the Project. Your father died for it. Your sister was taken because of it. Kurtzweil finishes nature's call. Zips up. Heads after Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder is coming from the back. Kurtzweil moving to catch up. And he does, at the coat stand. The place has pretty much cleared out, except for the Barmaid and some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you come here now and again. Figured you'd be needing a little drinky tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a reporter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor, but I think I mentioned that. OB-GYN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came on my own. After reading about the bombing in Dallas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you've got something to tell me, you've got as long as it takes me to hail a cab... Mulder starts out the door, but Kurtzweil grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to pin Dallas on you, Agent Mulder. But there was nothing you could've done. Nothing anyone could've done to prevent that bomb from going off. Because the truth is something you'd never have guessed; never have predicted. Mulder pulls away from Kurtzweil, but Kurtzweil dogs him to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is empty, the hour is late. Mulder moves to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.A.C. Darius Michaud never tried or intended to defuse the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rhetorical disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just let it explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the question nobody's asking? Why that building? Why not the Federal Building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federal Building was too well guarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They put the bomb in the building across the street because it DID have federal offices. The Federal Emergency Management Agency had a provisional medical quarantine office there. Which is where the bodies were found. But that's the thing... Mulder's got his hand up for a taxi coming. It's pulling over as Mulder steps from the curb, stepping away from Kurtzweil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the thing you didn't know. That you'd never think to check. Mulder's got the taxi door open, turning to Kurtzweil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those people were already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the bomb went off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying. Mulder stares at Kurtzweil for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaud was a twenty-two year veteran of the bureau --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaud was a patriot. The men he's loyal to know their way around Dallas. They blew that building to hide something. Maybe something even they couldn't predict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying they destroyed an entire building to hide the bodies of three firemen...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one little boy. Mulder gets in the cab, closes the door. Rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Kurtzweil raps the top of the roof and steps away from the car. As the taxi takes off. WE STAY WITH KURTZWEIL, watching Mulder's cab speed away. (NOTE: This should also be covered from inside the cab with Mulder, to play the scene out on him.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully is in bed, lying awake. Staring at the ceiling. When she reacts to a POUNDING AT HER DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE FRONT DOOR. Scully peeks in the peephole. Then she removes the safety chain, opening the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangely intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wake you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? It's three AM. Scully gets a whiff of his breath. As he moves past her into the apartment. Radiating a kind of manic intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk, Mulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was until about an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that before or after you got the idea to come here? Mulder looks at her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you implying, Scully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you may have gotten drunk and decided to come here to talk me out of quitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you'd like me to do? Scully hesitates. Long enough to indicate her own wavering heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Mulder. It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dressed, Scully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder -- what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get dressed. I'll explain on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon is rising over the horizon, across the curvilinear distance of endless scrub and sagebrush. When FLYING OBJECTS cross between it and us, their forms unidentifiable in the rising heat waves off the earth. But they are moving towards us, SILHOUETTES in the background of the moon. They move silently, their size INCREASING as they move closer. And then we hear them, moments before they arrive at our position, UNMARKED HELICOPTERS just overhead. Hugging the ground as they blast across the dark Texas night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying at dangerously low altitude over the almost featureless night landscape. Heading for something that we see ahead in the distance. What looks like a LARGE GLOWING DOME surrounded by the lights of a residential area we've already seen, on the edge of suburban Dallas sprawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field where the kids had been digging has been transformed into some kind of worksite. A LARGE WHITE DOMED TENT has been erected over almost the entire patch of ground, surrounded by the CARGO TRUCKS that we saw earlier, and more unmarked vans and trucks. There are men in black fatigues moving about, and scientists in haz-mat suits. As the UNMARKED BLACK HELICOPTERS bank overhead. Coming in for a landing in the glow cast from the tents. CAMERA MOVING TOWARD one of the helicopters as it lightly touches down and its black door swings open. A man stepping out, and as CAMERA PUSHES UP INTO HIS FACE we recognize him as The Cigarette Smoking Man. The figure that we've come to know as an assassin and a model of modern self-interest and amorality. One of the central protagonists in the conspiracy to keep the truth from the American people about the existence of extraterrestrial life. Something known only as: "The Project." He walks out from under the whirring prop, just far enough to get a flame from his lighter, to get a cigarette lit. As we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCIENTIST in a haz-mat suit is moving through the maze of clear plastic tubing that divides work areas within the tent. Areas where scientists are working at tables doing what appears to be some kind of high-tech archeological work. It is a hive of activity within, as the Scientist leads us past the REFRIGERATION UNITS to the earthen hole where Dr. Bronschweig (we've met him earlier, coming out of a med-evac chopper that landed when the tent city was erected) appears out of the earthen hole, which is reason for all this excitement. Climbing out A CLEAR HATCH which has been fashioned to cover the hole. Seeing:

dialogues.speaker: THE CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
dialogues.text: Now suited up himself. Bronschweig approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got something to show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous excitement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we originally established as icy, and what later became the unfrozen Texas field where the boys discovered the human skull, has been turned to its previously icy state. Thanks to two large vents that Dr. Bronschweig is pointing at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We brought the atmosphere back down to freezing in order to control the development, which is nothing like we've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought on by what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat, I think. The coincident invasion of a host, the fireman, and an environment that raised his basic body temperature above ninety eight point six. They step over to a section of the cave which has been draped with more plastic, the lights from inside this are giving off a cool blue light (passing by TWO PORTABLE DRILLING RIGS which have been erected, their pumps moving up and down like rocking horses.) Bronschweig pushes away the plastic, revealing A MAN lying on a gurney draped in plastic. he is hooked up to various and sundry machines which are monitoring his life signs. His skin has turned almost translucent, the veins and capillaries now clearly visible, as is his pulse. His heartbeat sending life-sustaining blood and energy through his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically and biologically, though he'll never recover. The CSM is shaking his head in nervous, uneasy wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can this be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The developing organism is using his life energy, digesting bone and tissue. We've just slowed the process. Bronschweig redirects a light so that it shines hard into the man's face and; then we see it. Movement.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S FACE
dialogues.text: Though the man's eyes still blink occasionally, we can actually see through his tissue and the bones in his skull to see something IS LIVING INSIDE HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cigarette Smoking Man's mind is working intently on all the possibilities, and consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to destroy this one, too? Before it gestates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No...we need to try our vaccine on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it's unsuccessful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incinerate it. Like the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man's family will want to see the body laid to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them he was trying to save the young boy's life, and that he died heroically like the other firemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seemed to buy our story about the Hanta virus. You'll make sure the families are taken care of financially, along with a sizeable donation to the community. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a small roadside memorial. He watches the CSM exit, then back to the prostrate fireman.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTRATE FIREMAN
dialogues.text: There is more movement within his body. Within his chest and neck, as if the creature gestating inside is continuing to stretch and grow. So that now we can see one of its BLACK EYES staring from through the clear flesh of the fireman. An eye which BLINKS at us. As we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder and Scully appear at the end of a long hall. Moving TOWARD CAMERA where a YOUNG NAVAL GUARD sits in f.g. As a LEGEND appears, to establish. Mulder and Scully moving the long distance to the Guard's station. Where the Guard looks up at them with military scrutiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ID and floor you're visiting. They both show their FBI IDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That area is currently off limits to anyone other than authorized medical personnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On whose orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General McAddie's. Mulder doesn't miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General McAddie is who requested our coming here. We were awakened at three AM and told to get down here immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, call General McAddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have his number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can patch you in through the switchboard. The Guard is nervous about this, checking his watch. He picks up the phone, going through a large directory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! We don't have time to dick around here watching you demonstrate your ignorance in the chain of command. The order came direct from General McAddie. Call him. We'll conduct our business while you confirm authorization. Mulder is already directing Scully past the Naval Guard who tentatively picks up the phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to their backs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go on ahead head and I'll confirm authorization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. LEADING Mulder and Scully, moving they've pulled off a con.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is a morgue suddenly off limits on orders of a general?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING TABLE HEIGHT across gurneys where white sheet-wrapped bodies lie. CAMERA LANDING ON Scully. Standing next to Mulder who is undoing the peculiar ropey stitching on the sheet used to secure the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of the firemen who died in Dallas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to this tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you that without even looking at him. (off Mulder's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conclusive organ failure due to proximal exposure to source and flying debris. Scully pulls out an autopsy report that was laid on the gurney under the body of the sheet-wrapped corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This body has already been autopsied, Mulder. You can tell from the way it's been wrapped and dressed. Undeterred, Mulder works to get the sheet off. The first thing we notice is that he's still in his fireman's uniform. His face looks familiar to us, not because we know him, but because of the translucency of skin we saw in the other fireman. (We will also notice he's missing an arm, a leg and large part of his torso.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this fit the description you just read me, Scully? Scully comes around, reacting to what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. This man's tissue... Scully is quickly removing a pair of latex gloves, stretching them on to palpate the man's tissue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some kind of cellular breakdown. It's completely edematous. She palpates the spongy skin on the man's face, neck. Unbuttoning the uniform now, seeing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's been no autopsy performed. There's no Y incision here; no internal exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me the cause of death on the report is false. That this man didn't die from an explosion, or from flying debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what killed this man. I'm not sure if anybody else could claim to either. Off Mulder's reaction to this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gurney with the fireman is pushed through a pair of swinging doors into the darkened lab. Scully flips the lights on, looking around at the giant facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew this man didn't die at the bomb site before we got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been told as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying the bombing was a cover-up. Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I have a hunch what you're going to find here isn't anything that can be categorized or easily referenced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder, this is going to take some time, and somebody's going to figure out soon enough we're not even supposed to be here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in serious violation of medical ethics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being blamed for these deaths. Scully, I want to know what this man died of. Don't you? Scully stares at Mulder, then back down at the body. How can she refuse, given the finality and the personal appeal of the request? After a moment's hesitation, she turns to the body, and to the tray table of tools nearby. Resigned, if not resolved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LEGEND appears: WASHINGTON D.C., DUPONT CIRCLE. 4:00 AM. The street is fairly empty, save for a garbage truck picking up the stacks of green garbage bags laid out on the sidewalks. Then A TAXI turns off a main street, MOVING TOWARDS US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER MULDER to the street: Where the taxi is moving forward toward a spot where two ARLINGTON PD cruisers are pulled up to the curb. Mulder checks the address he has written down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Cabbie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is it up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi pulls over and Mulder exits, starting up the steps of a walk up where the door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are UNIFORMED OFFICERS inside, and a DETECTIVE. Mulder steps into an office. FOUR PAIRS of eyes give him the once over. The Detective stepping over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Dr. Kurtzweil's residence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some kind of business with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for him for what? Mulder pulls out his ID, flashes it at the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his partners)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feds are looking for him, too. (turns to Mulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real nice business he's got, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling naked pictures of little kids over his computer. Mulder nods, though this is news to him. He steps in a little further, noticing a shelf lined with books. Their spines all have the author's name written large: DR. ALVIN KURTZWEIL. Mulder picks up one of these books, with the title: THE FOUR HORSEMEN OF THE GLOBAL DOMINATION CONSPIRACY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for him for some other reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had an appointment for a pelvic examination. They stare at Mulder like he's a sicko. He smiles and they break into RAUCOUS LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a call if we turn up Kurtzweil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't bother. Mulder puts the book back among the others on the shelf. And exits. Onto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder starting up the street when he notices:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurtzweil has stepped from between two apartments. He's staring at Mulder, nodding furtively to him. Then stepping back.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER
dialogues.text: Slows, then speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder appears at the end of the narrow walkway, finding Kurtzweil tucked a few yards in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this bullshit...? Somebody knows I'm talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not according to the men in blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Kiddie porn again? Sexual battery of a patient? I've had my license taken away in three states.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to discredit you -- for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Because I'm a dangerous man. Because I know too much about the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that apocalyptic trash you write? I knew your name was familiar. I just didn't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kurtzweil, I'm not interested in bigoted ideas about race or genocide. I don't believe in the Elders of Zion, the Knights Templar, the Bilderburg Group or in a oneworld Jew run government --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't either, but it sure sells books. He says it with an ironic smile. Causing Mulder to turn and start off. But Kurtzweil hurries to grab him, to prevent this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was right about Dallas. Wasn't I, Agent Mulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked up the historical document of the venality and hypocrisy of the American government. The daily newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said the firemen and the boy were found in the temporary offices of the Federal Emergency Management Agency. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the newspaper, FEMA had been called out to manage an outbreak of the Hanta virus. Are you familiar with the Hanta virus, Agent Mulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a deadly virus spread by field mice in the Southwest U.S. several years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are you familiar with FEMA? What the Federal Emergency Management Agency's real power is? FEMA allows the White House to suspend constitutional government upon declaration of a national emergency. To create a non-elected government. Think about that. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is an agency with such broad sweeping power doing managing a small viral outbreak in suburban Texas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying it wasn't such a small outbreak? Kurtzweil is getting intense now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying it wasn't the Hanta virus. They are both given a start when a POLICE CRUISER rolls by on the street, giving a burp of its siren. It rolls past as the two men tuck in tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we were young men in the military, your father and I were recruited for a project. They told us it was biological warfare. A virus. There were rumors about its origins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What killed those men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What killed them I won't even write about. I tell you, they'd do more than just harass me. They have the future to protect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll know soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worked up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What killed those men can't be identified in simple medical terms. My god, we can't even wrap our minds around something as obvious as HIV. We have no context for what killed those men, or any appreciation of the scale in which it will be unleashed in the future. Of how it will be transmitted; of the environmental factors involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plague?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plague to end all plagues, Agent Mulder. A silent weapon for a quiet war. The systematic release of an indiscriminate organism for which the men who will bring it on still have no cure. They've been working on this for fifty years. While the rest of the world was fighting gooks and commies these men have been secretly negotiating a planned Armageddon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negotiating with whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know. The timetable has been set. It will happen on a holiday, when people are away from their homes. When our elected officials are at their resorts or out of the country. The President will declare a state of emergency, at which time all federal agencies, all government will come under the power of the Federal Emergency Management Agency. FEMA, Agent Mulder. The secret government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they tell me I'm paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's gone wrong -- something unanticipated. Go back to Dallas and dig. Or you're only going to find out like the rest of the country, Agent Mulder. When it's too late. Kurtzweil turns, starts off. Mulder stares after him. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I reach you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. Mulder moves to catch up to Kurtzweil, pulling out his cell phone. Kurtzweil stops, turns. Truly and intensely paranoid. Mulder makes him take the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No calling Hawaii. Mulder turns and moves back out onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Scully wears a surgical mask, latex gloves. Working on the body of the fireman...when she reacts to a NOISE. Doors opening, closing somewhere o.s. CAMERA MEDIUM WHIPS to a door where she and Mulder entered the morgue. Where...the Young Naval Guard and TWO MPs push through and enter. They stand looking at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Scully stood moments ago, there is now just an unattended gurney. A sheet over the fireman's body. Scully is gone. RESUME YOUNG NAVAL GUARD, MPs Tense. Listening, watchful. Moving into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully enters the space where she and Mulder found the fireman's body. Trying to quietly click the door shut. Standing now near the door, tense, listening. When the CHIRPING of her cell phone breaks the tense silence. She pats frantically at her coat, trying to get it answered before it rings again. Unsuccessfully. Finally getting a hold of it and hitting the send button. Scully sits breathing heavy, nervous breaths -- waiting for the Young Naval Guard to come running in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully...? She puts the phone slowly up to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder's at the pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you whispering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really talk right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence of a massive infection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of infection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully -- listen to me. I'm going home, then I'm booking a flight to Dallas. I'm getting you a ticket, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you there with me. I need your expertise on this. The bomb we found was meant to destroy those bodies and whatever they were infected by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a hearing tomorrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll have you back for it, Scully. Maybe with evidence that could blow that meeting away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder -- I can't -- I'm already way past the point of common sense here
Scully hears VOICES in the hall outside the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully...? Hello...? But the line OFF, goes dead. Mulder  hangs up the phone, frustrated. Exits the booth in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and the Young Naval Guard steps inside, followed by the MPs. Moving into the room.

dialogues.speaker: TRACKING
dialogues.text: with the Naval Guard's feet as they pass by the rolling carts on which bodies are laid. TRACKING to find SCULLY, where she hides under one of the carts. Huddled and cold. The Guard's feet stop near here. He stands motionless for a moment, then moves off. HOLD her until the door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters a forensics lab with a FIELD AGENT. A LEGEND reads: FBI FIELD OFFICE, DALLAS : 11:20 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking for what amounts to a needle in a haystack. I'm afraid the explosion was so devastating there hasn't been a whole lot we've been able to put together just yet. They are walking amid BOXES of evidence. STACKS of debris. There are FORENSIC TECHS sorting through this material. It looks like the most tedious and painstaking job in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for anything out of the ordinary. Maybe something from the FEMA offices where the bodies were found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't expecting to find those remains, of course. They went right off to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anything in those offices that didn't go to D.C.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some bone fragments came up in the sift this morning. We thought there'd been another fatality, but we found out FEMA had recovered them from an archeological site out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you examined them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just fossils, far as I know. Mulder is nodding, when both men look off at something that's caught their attention o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like this person to take a look, if you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCULLY
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway to the lab. She looks at Mulder as if she's come in spite of her misgivings. Moving toward them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just see if I can lay my hands on what you're looking for. The Field Agent nods to Scully as he passes, exiting deeper into the room. Leaving Mulder and Scully by themselves momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you weren't coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't planning on it. Particularly after spending a half hour in cold storage this morning. But I got a better look at the blood and tissue samples I took from the firemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice lowering pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I couldn't show to anyone else. Not without more information. And not without causing the kind of attention I'd just as soon avoid right now. (off Mulder's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The virus those men were infected with contains a protein coat I've never seen before. What it did to them it did extremely fast. And unlike the AIDS virus or any other aggressive strain, it survives very nicely outside the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was it contracted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I don't know. But if it's through simple contact of blood to blood, and if it doesn't respond to conventional treatments, it could be a serious health threat. Mulder's reaction is postponed, or at least subdued by the reappearance of the field agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, these are fossils, and they weren't near the blast center, so they aren't going to tell you much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? He offers Scully the small glass vials in which the bone fragments have been separated. She takes them, looking at them on her way over to the microscope. Tapping out a tiny fragment onto the viewing bed. She puts her eyes down to the stereoscope eyepieces, then almost immediately looks up at Mulder who translates this look almost instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
