dialogues.text: You said you knew the location of the archeological site where these were found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show you right on a map. Off Mulder and Scully's traded looks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The domed white tent is still in place, the fleet of trucks and equipment surrounding it unmanned. Several large sound-dampened generators still hum away, but the work being done here would be a mystery to anyone who didn't have access to the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electric Bobcat-like bulldozer maneuvers a very high tech-looking CLEAR CONTAINER to the edge of the earthen hole. The container has monitors and gauges on it, oxygen tanks and what looks like a circulation refrigeration unit. A self-contained life support system. The inside of the container is covered with a thin layer of frost. When the small bulldozer gets the container over near the hole, several technicians lift it down off the shovel, hand carrying it toward the hole opening. As Dr. Bronschweig APPEARS, moving to a ladder that leads down into the hole. He's dressed in a haz-mat suit, with the hood off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to have those settings checked and re-set. I need a steady minus two Celsius through the transfer of the body, after I administer the vaccine. The men nod to Bronschweig, begin checking the settings as Bronschweig puts his hood on, starts down into the hole, through the clear hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The refrigeration vents are still pumping in arctic air when Dr. Bronschweig appears descending a fixed ladder. It is dark in here, save for the ice blue glow of light coming from the plastic draped area where we saw the fireman acting as an incubator/host for some kind of organism growing inside him. Bronschweig steps over to this area, moves aside the plastic drapery to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the body of the fireman is still inside the quarantine bubble litter in f.g. Bronschweig takes out of his pocket a SYRINGE and an AMPULE. Turning now to the body. Stepping to it. Moving a work light, as he had done for the Cigarette Smoking Man, so that it shines on the face of the fireman. But when he does this, Bronschweig nearly JUMPS, his breath stolen away. Reacting to:

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN'S BODY
dialogues.text: The chest and torso have imploded. It has been turned into a muddy mass of blood-stained jelly; bone and tissue melted into an oozing mass which has sunken due to the fact that the creature which was inside is now gone. CAMERA WHIPS from Bronschweig to the wall. To the temperature gauge which reads about 6 degrees Celsius. WHIPPING BACK to Bronschweig who is now panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE DOWN ON EARTHEN HOLE, where the Technicians Bronschweig was speaking to minutes ago react to Bronschweig's MUFFLED VOICE. He's down below them in the cave, looking up. Pulling his haz-mat hood off. Yelling up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's left the body. I think it's gestated -- Bronschweig is starting up the ladder when something stops him.

dialogues.speaker: BRONSCHWEIG
dialogues.text: He stands frozen on the ladder, squinting into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- I see it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadows there is movement, the creature edging into the light cast from the draped area. We see it is fully formed -- a replica of the Creature we saw at the opening of our story. Though it does not make any kind of aggressive move. As if, newborn, it is tentative.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME BRONSCHWEIG
dialogues.text: He remains standing on a rung of the ladder for a moment, then takes a gentle step back down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous wonder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's...amazing. You want to get down here -- (sotto to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Lord...so much for little green men. Dr. Bronschweig moves shakily to put the syringe in the ampule again...when, suddenly, the Creature STRIKES. CAMERA RUSHING FORWARD TO BRONSCHWEIG.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE TECHNICIANS
dialogues.text: As the Creature slams into Bronschweig, knocking him out of the line of sight from the top of the earthen hole. There are SCREAMS OF PAIN from Bronschweig, then they abate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bronschweig can be heard, but not clearly seen. He is in the shadows himself now. Trying to pick himself up, and when he manages to do this, teetering back into the light we see that he is bloodied. He is hurt, injured. Making his way back toward the patch of light that comes from the hole above. Hoping to see that help is on its way, while keeping a watchful, wary and worried eye on the shadows, for another attack by the Creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I need help. But the Technicians looking down on him offer him nothing of the sort. All they do is quickly close the clear hatch that seals Bronschweig inside the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! But he gets no answer, climbing the ladder shakily. A moment later the first Bobcat shovel-full of dirt falls onto the clear hatch and partially obscures the light. They are burying Bronschweig alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE DOWN ON BRONSCHWEIG through the glass hatch. His SCREAMS continue. ADJUSTING to the small bulldozer which is quickly hauling the mound of excavated earth into the hole from which it came. While, all around, there is a hive of activity. Men running everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bronschweig reacts in silent horror now, only to turn in further horror when he feels the impending attack of:

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: Right behind and just below him. Its grotesque features in momentary high resolution, BEFORE IT ATTACKS CAMERA. Over and over, savaging Bronschweig in a violent fury. Its hideous teeth tearing at his flesh - AT CAMERA - driving him off the ladder where the attack continues in momentary glimpses of teeth, of bloody flesh, and of OILY BLACK BLOOD being spattered about. At the height of the violence we hear Bronschweig SCREAM. Matching the wound of this, as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHILD'S SCREAM OF JOY. ENGLISH CHILDREN are playing tag or some kind of children's game in the well-manicured garden of a man who the CAMERA FINDS IN F.G. -- the man we have come to know as THE WELL-MANICURED MAN. He is also a member of the syndicate running "The Project", though his venality is cloaked in civility and statesmanship. Right now he's watching the children from the back steps of his mansion, charmed by their game. When he is called by someone o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- you have a call. The Well-Manicured Man turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: HIS VALET
dialogues.text: Holds the door. After a moment the W.M.M. enters past the Valet. As the screams of the children continue to rise and fall.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: The Well-Manicured Man enters, picks up a blinking line. Through a window he can still see the children playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a situation. The members are assembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it an emergency?

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT CSM AT INT. KENSINGTON BUILDING
dialogues.text: (NEXT LOC.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A meeting is set. Tonight in London, to determine a course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who called this meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strughold. He's just gotten on a plane in Tunis. This pronouncement has the power of ending any further questions. An immediate sense of gravity of the situation. The W.M.M. hangs up, moves to the window where he sees some of the HELP is running from the house. The children have all gathered around a BOY who seems to have hurt himself. He's lifted and being carried by the man who's called the W.M.M. into the house. Off the Well-Manicured Man's concern, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A discreet Town Car pulls up out front an understated building in a better West End neighborhood. A driver exits coming around for the Well-Manicured Man who is already exiting, moving to the building. As a LEGEND appears: KENSINGTON, LONDON: 8:01 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Well-Manicured Man is admitted by a Valet. The interior has the well-heeled look of money, or a finely appointed residence that no one lives in. The Valet takes the W.M.M.'s coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Strughold arrived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the library. He leads the W.M.M. down a hall, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF MEN are standing, looking at something on a TV monitor. A surveillance video. They turn when the W.M.M. enters. CAMERA FAVORING A SMALL LEAN MAN with close-cropped hair. He is at once elegant and imposing with eyes that hold you with laser-like acuity. He is CONRAD STRUGHOLD. The others are of various ethnicities, tailored and dignified. This might be a collection of U.N. delegates. Indeed some are. Their business here, however, doesn't represent anyone's interests but their own. As tipped by the attendance of a GROUP ELDER from the U.S. who we've come to know. But, more importantly, by the Cigarette Smoking Man who holds the VCR remote. He pauses the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We began to worry. Some of us have traveled so far, and you are the last to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. My grandson fell and broke his leg. The non-response to this has the same effect as a reprimand. But the W.M.M. will not apologize of kowtow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While we've been made to wait, we've watched surveillance tapes which have raised more concerns. The Well-Manicured Man glances to the TV, sees the frame paused.

dialogues.speaker: TV MONITOR
dialogues.text: Where Mulder and Scully's faces are seen in a hallway that we recognize as the Bethesda Naval Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More concerns than that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been forced to reassess our role in Colonization by new facts of biology which have presented themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The virus has mutated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On its own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its effect on the host has changed. The virus no longer just invades the brain as a controlling organism. It's developed a way to modify the host body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new extraterrestrial biological entity. It takes a moment to sink in. The weight of this fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The geometry of mass infection presents certain conceptual re-evaluations for us. About our place in their Colonization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't Colonization, it's spontaneous repopulation. All our work... if it's true, then they've been using us all along. We've been laboring under a lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be an isolated case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to tell them what we've found. What we've learned. Turn over a body infected with the gestating organism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In hope of what? Learning that it's true?! That we are nothing more than digestives for the creation of a new race of alien lifeforms?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me remind you who is the new race. And who is the old. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could be gained by withholding anything from them; By pretending to ignorance? Our knowledge may forestall their plans to step up the timetable. To start Colonization early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it doesn't? By cooperating now we're but beggars to our demise! Our ignorance was in cooperating with the Colonists at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooperation is our only chance of saving ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still need us to carry out their preparations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll continue to use them as they do us. If only to play for more time, to continue work on our vaccine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our vaccine may have no effect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, without a cure for the virus, we're nothing more than digestives anyway. All eyes go to the Well-Manicured Man. He is respected, if not the odd man out in this room. But he is all restrained anger now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lateness may have well been absence. A course has already been taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are complications. He turns back to the TV monitor where Mulder and Scully remain frozen on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder was in Dallas when we were trying to dispose of evidence. He's gone back there again. Someone has tipped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurtzweil, we think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've allowed this man his freedom. His books have actually helped us to facilitate plausible denial. Has he outlived his usefulness to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one believes Kurtzweil or his books. He's a toiler. A crank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our new situation makes us vulnerable. If he learns information as we do, he could jeopardize the Project's secrecy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control of information means control of Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can control Mulder. I've always controlled Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may take another approach. He says this, casting his look toward the Well-Manicured Man. A look of cold malevolence. The W.M.M.'s reaction is disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill Mulder. He's got too much light on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need not kill a man to destroy him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (personalizing the inference)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you need only take away what is most precious to him.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCULLY
dialogues.text: She stands against a backdrop of Texas flatland, squinting into the sun. Shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mulder... We are: WIDE ANGLE REVERSE, TO INCLUDE MULDER, standing in the middle of a park, replete with jungle gyms, playground equipment. All brand spanking new. They are standing right where there had once been a hard scrabble, parched and barren little field. Where the earthen hole had been dug by the young boys. And what had later been the site of so much activity by the group of scientists. But where there's now a park, thick green grass covering the parch of ground, including the spot where the hole had been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't mention a park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he marked on the map, Scully. Where he says those fossils were unearthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any evidence of an archeological or any other kind of digsite. Not even a sewer or a storm drain. Mulder scans the area, confounded. Shaking his head as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure the fossils you looked at showed the same signs of deterioration you saw in the fireman's body in the morgue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bone was porous, as if the virus of the causative microbe were digesting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've never seen anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It didn't show up on any of the immunohistochemical tests -- Mulder is listening to all this while looking down at his feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks like new grass to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks pretty green for this climate. Mulder stops, kneels, touches the thick green carpet of turf. He digs around, lifting up a corner of a new square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground's dry about an inch down. Somebody just laid this down. Very recently, I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the equipment is brand new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No irrigation system. Somebody's covering their tracks. They both turn, looking at something that's caught their attention on the street where their rental car is parked. Three kids, all of whom we recognize from earlier. Stevie's "friends". Tooling down the street on new BMX bikes. Reacting to Mulder's loud WHISTLE. This stops them, staring at Mulder blankly across the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! They don't answer. Just keep staring, squinting into the sun. Mulder and Scully start walking toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you live around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. As the Agents approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anybody digging here? The kids don't answer quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not supposed to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to talk about it? Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. Same nobody who put this park in? That new equipment... (off the boys guilty looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They buy you these bikes? The kids shift uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't even know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're FBI agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not FBI agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause FBI agents wear like suits and goofy ties. And dresses like my mom wears to church. Like on that one show. Mulder and Scully pull their badges. The kids' mouths drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you've been watching too much TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all left twenty minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going that way. The kids all pointing in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mulder and Scully's rental car RACES by at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder at the wheel, foot to the floor. Scully's got a map out. The mood is urgent, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unmarked tanker trucks... what are archaeologists hauling out in tanker trucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where are they going with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first question to answer, if we're going to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder slows down to a stop. They've come to a three-way intersection in the middle of absolutely nowhere that offers them three choices. The car sits idling for several beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder's got his hand on his face rubbing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are my choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a hundred miles of nothing in each direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would they be going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got two choices. One of them is wrong. They are both looking in different directions. The car idling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they went left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I think they went right. A few moments of silence. Then Mulder steps on the gas and goes straight. Heading out onto the only unpaved road. Accelerating away. Scully looks at him, wondering. As they bump along at speed. Mulder won't look at her for a few moments. Then, turning to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years together -- how many times have I been wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADLIGHTS appear in the distance on a long, dusty stretch of road. GROWING as they approach, then coming to a stop in a cloud of dust as they move into f.g. Where a LINE OF FENCEPOSTS, BARBWIRE blocks their path. As the car brakes, the passenger door opens and Scully exits. A hot Texas wind blows. A dog is BARKING somewhere. Scully walks into the headlight wash, looking at a sign on the fence. After a moment, the driver's door opens and Mulder exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I was right about the bomb, wasn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great. This is fitting.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON SCENE
dialogues.text: On the fence sign, painted in crude letters, are the words: SOME HAVE TRIED, SOME HAVE DIED. TURN BACK -- NO TRESPASSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to be in Washington D.C. in eleven hours for a hearing -- the outcome of which might possibly affect one of the biggest decisions of my life. And here I am standing out in the middle of nowhere Texas, chasing phantom tanker trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not chasing trucks, we're chasing evidence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- of what exactly?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bomb in Dallas was allowed to go off, to hide something: bodies infected with a virus you detected yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haul gas in tanker trucks, they haul oil in tanker trucks -- they don't haul viruses in tanker trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well they may this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by haul? (off his reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you not telling me here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This virus -- it... (afraid to say)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may be extraterrestrial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this. I don't fucking believe this. (reaching her limit of impatience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I've been here... I've been here one too many times with you, Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pounding down some dirt road in the middle of the night. Chasing some elusive truth on a dim hope, only to find myself standing right where I am right now: at another dead end -- As she says this A BELL starts to sound. A flashing light hits Mulder and Scully. They both turn to see:

dialogues.speaker: A RAILROAD CROSSING SIGN
dialogues.text: Sitting all by its lonely self. No swinging arms or gate. Just one little sign between Mulder and Scully and their car. CAMERA PANNING to the light of a locomotive speeding toward us.

dialogues.speaker: TRACKS TO MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: They move toward their car, but the train is coming fast. Mulder and Scully stop and wait, watching the train. As the engine breaks frame, eclipsing Mulder and Scully from view. And as it passes by we see TWO VERY FAMILIAR WHITE TANKERS loaded piggyback atop flat bed cars. The train, which is not much longer than this, passes. And Mulder and Scully make a mad dash for their car. The lights come on and Mulder swings the vehicle into a hard accelerating turn, taking the spoke of the intersection that parallels the tracks. As the car hauls ass after the train, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rails come up a grade where they appear out of a long bending turn. Exiting the mountain pass near the summit of the mountain. And now HEADLIGHTS appear, bouncing toward us. It's Mulder and Scully's rental chugging up the grade. And now pulling to a stop as it REACHES CAMERA. Then the car doors open and Mulder and Scully exit. Putting jackets against the cold desert night. Running over the gravel on the rail bed into sharp f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. They start out toward it anyway, whatever it is. But the image that we see next might cause us to ask the same question.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER AND SCULLY'S FORMER POV
dialogues.text: The Agents are moving off the tracks now, picking their way toward the horizon where, at the edge of the great plateau that lays out before them, there are TWO GIANT GLOWING WHITE DOMES. It is otherwise pitch dark out, almost giving the impression that the domes are floating. It would give the distinct impression of otherworldliness, if we hadn't seen a similar, smaller glowing dome over the dirt field where the boys found the skull. And if we could not see the lights of the TRAIN rolling to a stop near the mysterious domes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY CRANING DOWN as Mulder and Scully move through the low scrub of the high desert. Moving towards us as CAMERA CONTINUES ITS SLOW CRANE DOWN, REVEALING in f.g. the tops of CORN STALKS (yes, corn stalks.) What is the perimeter edge of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acres and acres of corn fields, laying out before us in the dark night. Running all the way to the WHITE DOMED TENTS in the b.g. Mulder and Scully enter the perimeter edge, disappearing into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH Mulder and Scully as they move through the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird, Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any thoughts on why anybody'd be growing corn in the middle of the desert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless those are giant Jiffy Pop containers out there. CONTINUE TRACKING as they move through the tall uniform rows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting down the long straight rows. CRANING UP to REVEAL DOMES once again. Like space ships that have landed.

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSITE PERIMETER OF THE FIELD OF CORN
dialogues.text: The Agents exit the edge of the crop field. They have come upon the glowing tents now. Tall and pillowy against the dark sky. There is no evidence of anyone about. No sound, no signs. Mulder and Scully stand at the edge of the field for a moment. Then move cautiously across an open area to one of the domes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder pulls open the steel door leading in. It opens with a SUCKING SOUND which suggests the interior is pressurized. And as he and Scully step in -- they both JUMP when LARGE FANS just overhead hit them both with hard blasts of air. Stepping quickly out of the downward blasting air, into the still silence of the space beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool in here. Temperature's being regulated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the purpose of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our view is down through the crosswires and cables that create the tension support. The effect is a combination of simplicity and perfect function. Stark and high tech. The flooring is gray and flat, featureless. But we don't yet see from this angle exactly what the white domed tent houses. Though the air is still and there is no movement of any kind, there is a sound that permeates the interior. A STEADY HUM. Almost electrical hum, but different. Mulder and Scully move together toward the middle of the space.

dialogues.speaker: TENT
dialogues.text: Laid out in a grid, low to the ground, are what look like BOXES. Fixed in place like roof vents, except these are on the floor, no more than three feet tall, and about the same measure square.

dialogues.speaker: TRACKING WITH MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: As they continue to move cautiously, walking out into the grid of box-shaped objects. Coming to the center of the capacious, arena-sized space. Standing over one of the mysterious boxes, which we now see have LOUVERED TOPS. The louvers, however, are shut so that whatever is inside the boxes cannot be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're on top of something. I think these are some kind of venting. Mulder lays his head and ear to the top of the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the humming. Like electricity. High voltage maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not. Scully looks skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think those are for? Mulder takes his ear off the box, looking up now, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the dome are two LARGE corresponding LOUVER VENTS.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: Looking up at these vents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH WIDE ANGLE OVER MULDER AND SCULLY, staring up JUST PAST CAMERA at the louvered vents at top center of the tent. When A LOUD METALLIC NOISE makes them jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the vents is opening automatically, its large metal louvers straining from their flat closed position into an up-and-down open position. When this is complete, the SECOND LOUVER does the same. The straining sound of galvanized metal-on-metal.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: As Mulder turns his look from the ceiling back down to the mysterious box they're standing next to. Something occurs to him. Something frightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. Mulder grabs her hand, pulling her along. Though she doesn't know why. Or what's about to happen. TRACKING FAST WITH THEM as Mulder leads her back toward the door they entered, which is a good hundred yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling, on the run)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! When the LOUVERED VENTS on all the low grid-arranged boxes OPEN IN DOMINO-LIKE SUCCESSION -- out of them pouring THOUSANDS AND THOUSANDS OF BEES, rapidly filling the atmosphere of the domed space. As if the insects are being shot out of non-stop cannons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THICK STREAMS of bees head RIGHT AT CAMERA, flying for the open louvers at the top of the dome. As Mulder and Scully run for it down below.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: Scully's hand slipping from Mulder's as she pulls her jacket up over her head. Mulder doing the same now, ducking his head inside his own jacket. The Agents are slowed by the bees but still make their zigzag way toward the door -- bees clinging to their clothes. But motion seems to be the key. As Mulder RUNS TOWARD CAMERA -- where the downward blast of air knocks all the bees off him. In the b.g., we see that Scully has fallen behind. Still running, but losing her way in the process, losing her bearings as the thickening swarm of bees descends.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: When Mulder enters frame, jacket pulled over his head again. Taking Scully by the back of her coat and swinging her toward the direction of the door. Whipsnapping her the rest of the distance to the doorfans. Following right behind her as the fans BLASTING them and the Agents continue right out the doors. To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully and Mulder comes blasting out themselves now, but they haven't even had time to catch their breaths when they react to MOVEMENT. Something coming at them in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where BRIGHT BEAMS BLAST ON, moving fast toward them. The RUSHING WHIR of the turbine engines of the unmarked choppers. The bright beams skimming across the ground toward Mulder and Scully, traveling right along the edges of ends of the white domed tents. Threatening to spot the Agents, unless they -- RUN. And they do -- bolting just as the beams and the helicopters blast over the spot they held just moments before. Running to:

dialogues.speaker: HANDHELD
dialogues.text: Running flat out now, knocking away the stalks and leaves that block their way. Following and leading shots. POVs and Tracking shots. And chasing angles, as the Agents run through the only cover they've got. As:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmarked helicopters swoop right overhead, their BRIGHT SPOTLIGHTS searching and cutting through the cornrows. As the Agents zig and zag just out of the discovering beams. As the choppers zoom right over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: Traversing the field, then doing sharp banking turns and swooping back over the field now in low drifting hovers. The wash from the blades knocking the corn stalks down so as to reveal anything hidden within. The bright spots making sure that nothing might escape detection.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA SEARCHING AND FINDING SCULLY
dialogues.text: as she runs up INTO FRAME. She's lost sight of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he too runs to a stop. Hearing his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully?!

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SCULLY
dialogues.text: Reacting to the sound of her name, but there's no time to find her bearings on Mulder. Not before she has to take flight again. As one of the choppers appears overhead, hovering into view. Knocking the corn down in a path moving straight toward her. CAMERA LEADING HER as she runs from the oncoming craft. PASSING CAMERA to the left, as the chopper passes CAMERA RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: FAST WITH MULDER
dialogues.text: Beating his way through the corn like Bomba through the jungle. Matching this action, as Mulder runs toward us. When one of the unmarked helicopters BREAKS INTO FRAME in an intersecting path, its BEAM passing right over Mulder and ILLUMINATING HIM. But while it doesn't slow Mulder down, the helicopter maneuvers into a hard banking turn, sweeping over the far end of the corn field and heading RIGHT BACK AT MULDER - AT US.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF CORN FIELD
dialogues.text: Where Mulder bursts out of the perimeter, turning on a quick dime and running an out pattern, just before the chopper BURSTS into frame overhead, its search beam narrowly missing Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: Running the corner of the field, looking frantically down each corn row until he comes to a stop. No sign of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully?! Mulder reacting to the sound of her response:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder!

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: She's exiting the field behind him. Running toward him, and when she gets to him they both break into a run across the desert. CAMERA FOLLOWING THEM as they sprint away. FOLLOWING THEM until they both start to slow. Slowing to a stop in the darkness. Turning to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopters have disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER AND SCULLY
dialogues.text: Reacting to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Then they both turn again and continue running. As fast as their feet will take them. Back towards the bluff where their car is parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Mulder and Scully's car is parked. Stillness, until Mulder and Scully's heads appear as they climb up from the direction of the corn fields. They get in their car and start it quickly. Mulder turns the ignition, but the car doesn't start immediately. He turns it over and over but it won't kick. As he does this, unbeknownst to the agents ONE OF THE BLACK HELICOPTERS rises up from below the bluff, appearing in their rear windshield. Hovering just behind the car like a giant bumblebee. Just as... ...Mulder gets the car started, throwing the transmission in gear and spinning the tires. As they head off back in the direction they came, without their lights on. As they do this, the black chopper continues to hover for a moment, then BANKS OFF AND AWAY. Into the night. Mulder and Scully speed off in the opposite direction. As we:

dialogues.speaker: A FILE
dialogues.text: Being leafed through by a woman's hands. CAMERA TILTING UP to Special Agent Cassidy, the woman we met earlier running the OPR hearing. She takes a quick glance at her watch, looking up when:

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO THE ROOM
dialogues.text: opens. A beat, then Skinner enters with a wearied look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming in. Skinner ducks his head back out to look at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Scully stands looking into the glass of a display case, trying to put her hair and clothes and person together. She's still in the same clothes we saw her in. Seeing Skinner now moving toward him.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME OPR HEARING ROOM
dialogues.text: Scully enters past Skinner. Though she has straightened them, and her hair, there is no mistaking that she's been to the dust bowl and back to get here. Her manner is chastened. Scully tries to keep her eyes on the table where she'll be sitting. Venturing only a brief, polite look to:

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE CASSIDY AND THE OTHER PANEL MEMBERS
dialogues.text: They reshuffle their papers, pulling up their chairs. Ready to get down to business now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agent Scully --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize for making you wait -- I've brought some new evidence with me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching into her satchel, pulling out an evidence bag. Whatever she's reaching for she's reluctant to present with confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are fossilized bone fragments I've been able to study, gathered from the bomb site in Dallas... As Scully speaks we see A BEE crawl out from under the collar of her suit jacket, crawling toward the back of her neck. Crawling slowly, as if stretching its legs from its long journey. CAMERA DOLLYING around Scully as the bee does, moving into an OVER to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been back to Dallas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to let us in on what exactly you're trying to prove --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the bombing in Dallas may have been to destroy the bodies of those firemen, so their deaths and the reason for them wouldn't have to be explained --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (challenging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- those are very serious allegations, Agent Scully --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I know. There is a hush of murmured responses to this, the panel members speaking to one another. Assistant Director Skinner shifts uneasily in his chair. He's been here before with Agents Mulder and Scully. He's sensing something outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have conclusive evidence of this? Something to tie this claim of yours to the crime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grudgingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing completely conclusive -- We have returned to the OVER ANGLE on Scully, where we see the BEE just below her jacket collar on the back of her neck. It CRAWLS back under her collar, DISAPPEARING from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope to. We're working to develop this evidence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder. Off Cassidy's knowing nod, a general shifting in chairs, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder pushes through the front, scanning the room for:

dialogues.speaker: KURTZWEIL
dialogues.text: Sitting at a booth at the dark rear of the establishment. Mulder enters frame, sitting down across from him. Kurtzweil is jumpy, but he sees from Mulder's expression that something's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. On the Texas border. Some kind of experiment. Something they excavated was brought there in tanker trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. A virus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You saw this experiment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did it look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were bees. And corn crops. Kurtzweil smiles at Mulder, laughs with nervous excitement. Mulder doesn't quite realize it yet, but this is news to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they? Kurtzweil slides from his seat, rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transportation system. Transgenic crops. The pollen genetically altered to carry a virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be my guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guess? But Kurtzweil doesn't respond to this. He's moving toward the back of the bar. Mulder slides out, pursuing him.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID
dialogues.text: The few PATRONS sitting at the bar, all turning in reaction to this sudden flurry of activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the bathrooms. Mulder catches up to Kurtzweil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, your guess? Kurtzweil doesn't stop. So Mulder must physically stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you had answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I don't have them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been using me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been using you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know my father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- he and I were old friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a liar. You lied to me to gather information for you. For your goddamn books. Didn't you? Mulder is getting heated, rough with Kurtzweil. When, unexpectedly A MAN suddenly exits the bathroom. REACTING to this scene. Kurtzweil uses the moment to break from Mulder. Slipping out the back door. Mulder takes a beat, then goes after him. Pushing out the back door into the blinding brightness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder busts out the back door, chasing Kurtzweil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurtzweil! Kurtzweil turns to him. With restrained ferocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be shit out of luck if not for me. You saw what you saw because I led you to it. I'm putting my ass on the line for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ass? I just got chased across Texas by two black helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do you think it is you're standing here talking to me? These people don't make mistakes, Agent Mulder. And with that he turns now, striding off. Leaving Mulder to deal with the excellent logic of this. When suddenly Mulder reacts to A NOISE. Somewhere above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on a fire escape, A MAN is moving. Mulder can only see his feet and legs from this angle, but it is clear he has been watching Mulder. Upon being spotted, the figure slides away and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE FIRE ESCAPE BUILDING
dialogues.text: We get a glimpse of the man who was watching him. A face we recognize as that of the man who brushed past Mulder coming out of the vending room, not long before the building in Dallas blew. He is moving quickly now, disappearing into the shadows. CAMERA TILTING DOWN to find: MULDER. He stands staring up, but only for a moment until he turns and hurries off in the opposite direction Kurtzweil disappeared in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE OVER MULDER'S DESK at the far end of the living room. The sound of keys in the door, then Mulder enters his apartment in a hurry. Moving to the desk and going at this pace through the drawers. Looking for... A PICTURE ALBUM. Which he takes now, leafing through it. Flipping the pages, looking for:

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: Finding old pictures of young Fox Mulder with his SISTER, Samantha. With his father and mother. The plastic-covered page is peeled back and one of these photos is removed. It is an old family snapshot. A picnic possibly. Mulder stares at the picture. INSERT PHOTO - In the b.g. of the picnic, his head turned to camera, is a young KURTZWEIL. Mulder studies the photo intensely, when there's a KNOCK at his door. Mulder turning to see:

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: In his haste, Mulder had neglected to lock his door. Scully is pushing it open. She's still in the same clothes. She looks beat. Her eyes meeting Mulder's. A gaze that says bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt Lake City, Utah. Transfer effective immediately. Mulder is shaking his head. Not wanting to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already gave Skinner my letter of resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't quit, Scully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can, Mulder. I debated whether or not to even tell you in person, because I knew --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're close to something here -- we're on the verge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on the verge, Mulder -- please don't do this to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what you saw last night -- after all you've seen -- you can't just walk away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have. I did. It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm contacting the state board Monday to file medical reinstatement papers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you on this, Scully --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't Mulder -- you've never needed me. I've only held you back. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. And with that she exits his apartment, the argument too painful, and her ability to be persuaded too clear to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ANGLE FROM END OF HALL where we see Scully, leaving Mulder's apartment. Moving at a hurried clip to the elevator -- TOWARD CAMERA. As if anticipating her own impulse to turn around and go back. As she moves into f.g. Mulder exits his apt. door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong -- He hurries to catch her. As she turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was I assigned to you? To debunk your work. To reign you in. To shut you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved me, Scully. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As different and frustrating as it's been sometimes, your goddamn strict rationalism and science have saved me a thousand times; have kept me honest and made me whole. I owe you so much, Scully, and you owe me nothing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this without you. I don't know if I can. If I quit now, they win. She is silent, moved. In spite of all her desire not to be. She moves to Mulder, holds him. They break slightly and she looks up at Mulder with deep respect, admiration and... kisses him on the forehead. When... ...suddenly a physical intimacy we've never seen. A heat and passion that can't be denied. The opportunity for the inevitable has presented itself. The moment of truth has arrived. Mulder is staring at Scully as she's looking back at him. His head moves slightly toward hers -- as one of his hands moves up to her neck, drawing her to him. Where there is hesitation on her part, there is also desire. When:

dialogues.speaker: OUCH
dialogues.text: Scully pulls away from Mulder, RUBBING at her neck where his hand had been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... something stung me. Scully's hand comes out with THE SQUIRMING BEE, which she holds in her hand while Mulder moves around her, checking her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must... But he doesn't finish his sentence before he has to catch Scully from falling. Her head bobs and she has to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong... (fighting for clarity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having -- lancinating pain -- my chest. My... motor functions are being affected. I'm... Mulder lays her down on the floor during this. Scully continues to speak, though her eyes are not focusing. She is limp in Mulder's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my pulse feels thready and I've got a funny taste in the back of my throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're in anaphylactic shock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it's -- Her voice is getting thin now, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no allergy. Something... this... Mulder... I think... I think you should call an ambulance. And Mulder is on his feet in a flash, running for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE OVER PHONE as Mulder races into the apartment, dashing TOWARD CAMERA, picking up the receiver, dialing. HOLDING ON THE PHONE during this action. TILTING UP for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Special Agent Fox Mulder. I have an emergency -- I have an agent down --

dialogues.speaker: SCULLY
dialogues.text: Picked up and one-two-three loaded on a gurney by TWO PARAMEDICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Can you say your name? Scully is trying, but the words won't come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got constriction in the throat and larynx -- are you breathing okay? He lays his head down to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passages are open. Let's get her in the van -- NEIGHBORS are in the hall now, along with Mulder. Who is moving beside the Paramedics as they hustle the gurney down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming through people -- here we go. Coming through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paramedics bang out the front door, stutter-stepping the gurney down to the walk, to their EMT VAN which sits at the curb with the LIGHT BAR FLASHING. Mulder following close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she had a taste in the back of her throat -- there was no pre-existing allergy to bee-stings -- the bee that stung her may have been carrying a virus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A virus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the radio, tell them we have a cytogenic reaction, we need an advise and administer -- They get her to the back of the vehicle, guiding the gurney in with experienced hands. Scully's eyes are on Mulder as she's slid into the brightly lit interior. The 1st Paramedic blocks Mulder somewhat as he steps toward the van, anticipating that he's going with them to the hospital. But the doors are closing on him before he gets an opportunity. FOLLOWING MULDER around to the driver's side of the van now, moving to the driver's window where THE DRIVER can be seen in the rear view mirror, his eyes watching Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: ON MULDER
dialogues.text: A moment of vague recognition -- a catch in his step.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: As Mulder's momentum carries him to the driver's window where se see again the man from the vending room, who was also surveilling Mulder. And he has a HANDGUN pointed at Mulder, which he FIRES THROUGH THE WINDOW. The glass shattering.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER
dialogues.text: Throwing himself away backward, but the bullet catches him in the head. Blood and glass spraying onto the side of the van. He goes down to the ground -- as the paramedic van accelerates fast away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying in the street, his head bleeding profusely. While in the b.g., A SECOND AMBULANCE IS SPEEDING TO THE SCENE. As it skids to a stop and TWO NEW PARAMEDICS jump out, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MEDIUM SIZED PRIVATE JET is taxiing down an alley off the main runway where a 747 is speeding toward takeoff. The private jet turning TOWARD CAMERA and nosing into f.g.

dialogues.speaker: TARMAC
dialogues.text: Where MEN IN FAMILIAR BLACK FATIGUES are unloading something from an unmarked cube truck that is also familiar: the very high tech-looking CLEAR CONTAINER, with its monitors and gauges, its oxygen tanks and refrigeration unit. A self-contained life support system. The inside of the container is covered with a thin layer of frost, through which we can see AGENT SCULLY. She lies as if in a state of paralysis, but a blink of her eyes is enough to tell us that she is... alive. TRACKING WITH THE MEN moving the container. As they hustle it to the waiting jet. As The Cigarette Smoking Man is descending the steps of the plane onto the tarmac. Watching as the container is moved to the cargo hold and loaded inside. The hold is closed and the jet engines wind back up. As the Cigarette Smoking Man reboards the aircraft and it taxis away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voices fade in slowly, inaudible at first. For regular viewers of the show, they will recognize the voices of the Lone Gunmen. Three nerdish paranoiacs who publish a magazine which charts and cataloged conspiracies past and present, among other government malfeasance. They are Langly, Byers and Frohike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's coming out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mulder... FADE UP, as if our eyes are blinking open. We are in Mulder's POV, and the face right above us is Frohike's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder...? Behind Frohike, looking down at Mulder, are Byers and Langly.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON MULDER
dialogues.text: Staring at the diminutive Frohike, the long-haired Langly and the courtly Byers with dawning recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Byers, then Langly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tin Man. Scarecrow. (to Frohike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toto. Mulder sits up now, rubbing his face, feeling the BANDAGE he's got on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were shot in the head. The bullet broke the flesh on your right brow and glanced off your temporal plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (woozy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penetration but not perforation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three centimetres to the left and we'd be playing the harp. Mulder is still shaking out the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave you a craniotomy to relieve the pressure from a subdural hematoma. But you've been unconscious since they brought you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days ago. Your guy Skinner's been here with you around the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the news and made a trip to your apartment. Found a bug in your phone line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one in your hall. Byers holds up the first small device. Frohike holds up a vial containing A BEE. Mulder realizing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scully had a violent reaction to a bee sting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called 911. Except the call was intercepted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took her -- Mulder pushes the covers off. Swinging his legs to the ground. As A.D. Skinner enters the room. Surprised to see Mulder up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Scully?! As he says this he loses his balance slightly, has to hold onto one of the Gunmen. Struggling with his faculties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's missing. We've been unable to locate her or the vehicle they took her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever they are -- this goes right back to Dallas -- it goes right back to the bombing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (off Mulder's reaction to this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Scully reported your suspicions to OPR. On the basis of her report, I sent techs over to S.A.C. Michaud's apartment. They picked up PSTN residues on his personal effects consistent with the construction of the vending machine device in Dallas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reeling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep does this go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Mulder sees A MAN IN A SUIT passes by the small window in the door, casting a furtive glance in, then moving off. He turns his look back to Skinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we being watched?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking any chances. Mulder nods. Pulling now at the bandage on his head. Peeling it away and revealing the wound beneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your clothes, Byers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to find Scully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I know someone who might have an answer. Who better. Mulder is undoing his hospital gown now, his white buns gracing the screen for the first time in history. As he ducks into the bathroom. As the men left standing in the room all look to Byers, reluctantly removing his duds. Off this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE OVER MAN IN A SUIT standing with his back to Mulder's room, reading a section of a newspaper (the rest of the paper sitting on a chair, as if the man's possibly set up here.) As the door to Mulder's room opens in the b.g. and Frohike appears. Frohike keeps his eyes on the Man as Langly appears now, followed by...Byers? We can't see clearly as the other two block our POV and the third man out doesn't show us his face. The threesome starts down the hall, their footsteps drawing the attention of the Man in a Suit.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER AND THE OTHER GUNMEN
dialogues.text: As they head TOWARD CAMERA. Walking at a pace. In the b.g. the Man in the Suit is drifting toward Mulder's hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN SUIT
dialogues.text: Suspicious. He moves to the door, looks in the little glass window. Seeing...Byers, the sheets pulled up to his nose to hide his beard and mustache. Skinner standing next to him, talking on the phone. The Man in the Suit looking down to the end of the hall again.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER AND THE GUNMEN
dialogues.text: As Mulder and his two flankers MOVE RIGHT TO CAMERA. Mulder is taking a cell phone being handed to him by Frohike. Dialing on the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE appears at the end of the alley, moving toward us. It could be Mulder from this distance, but as the figure comes closer we recognize him as Kurtzweil. Moving into the f.g., checking behind him, ahead of him. Jumpy. He takes a cautious beat, then moves to the door leading into the bar (established), reaching for the knob. Opening it, finding the Well-Manicured Man standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kurtzweil, isn't it? Dr. Alvin Kurtzweil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Kurtzweil is shaken by the sight of this man. Backpedaling a bit, looking around and behind him for an ambush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're surprised. Certainly you've been expecting some response to your indiscretion. The W.M.M. steps out of the doorway, following Kurtzweil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quite sure whatever you told Agent Mulder, you have your good reason. It's a weakness in men our age; the urge to confess. (stopping his walk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you that. Kurtzweil is thrown by the words, and the delivery. Stopping his backward progress. Studying this upright and civil man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must try to understand, what I'm here to do is only to protect my children. You and I have but short lives left. I can only hope the same isn't true for them. On this note, Kurtzweil turns and hoofs it back in the direction from which he came. TRACKING BACK WITH HIM until HEADLIGHTS hit his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOWN CAR has pulled into the alley behind him. Accelerating fast down the narrow corridor. Effectively trapping Kurtzweil in. As he squints into its headlights, then turns back with fear in his eyes to the W.M.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a figure is coming down the street toward us. Running, it's Mulder, going balls out. Running to the entrance of the bar and yanking open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moderately crowded as Mulder enters, stopping to catch his breath. Moving to the back of the bar. Looking for:

dialogues.speaker: THE BOOTH WHERE HE MET KURTZWEIL EARLIER
dialogues.text: It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER
dialogues.text: Moving through the bar -- real panic in his expression. He heads to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder passing the bathrooms, moving to the door where we saw the Well-Manicured Man standing just a short bit ago. But there is no one back here now. Mulder moves to the back door, the one leading to the alley, pushing it open and finding: The Well-Manicured Man stands with HIS DRIVER closing the trunk on the idling Town Car (which has been turned around.) The W.M.M. turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Kurtzweil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's come and gone. The W.M.M. moves to Mulder, who doesn't trust him for a second. Mulder is still breathing hard, sizing up this scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Scully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have answers for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Mulder stares at the W.M.M. - measuring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quite prepared to tell you everything, though there isn't much you haven't guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the conspiracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think of it as an agreement. A word your father liked to use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know where Scully is. The Well-Manicured Man suddenly reaches into his jacket pocket, without warning or explanation. Mulder tensing slightly. He removes a thin felt envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The location of Agent Scully. And the means to save her life. (off Mulder's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... He gestures toward the car where the Driver stands with the back door open. Mulder hesitates, then steps from the doorway. Moving past the W.M.M., sliding in. The W.M.M. gets in after him, closes the door. The car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE MULDER in the back seat, reflected in the rear-view mirror. Where we also see the eyes of the DRIVER watching him. Mulder is handed the felt envelope by the W.M.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weak vaccine against the virus Agent Scully has been infected with. It must be administered with ninety six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Though I have no way to prove otherwise. The virus is extraterrestrial. We know very little about it, except that it is the original inhabitant of this planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious, to say the least)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A virus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple, unstoppable lifeform. What is a virus but a colonizing force that cannot be defeated? Living in a cave, underground, until it mutates. And attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you've been conspiring to conceal? A disease?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! For God sake you've got it all backwards. This outburst comes suddenly, unexpectedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aids, the ebola virus -- on the evolutionary scale they are newborns. This virus walked the planet long before the dinosaurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, walked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your aliens, Agent Mulder, your little green men, first landed here millions of years ago. Those that didn't leave have been laying dormant underground since the last Ice Age. In the form of an evolved pathogen. Waiting to be reconstituted when the alien race from which it came returns to colonize the planet. Using us as hosts. Against this we have no defense. Nothing but a weak vaccine. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see why it was kept secret? Why even the best men -- men like your father -- could not let the truth be known? The force and conviction of his delivery leave Mulder shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until Dallas, we believed the virus was simply a controlling organism. That mass infection would make us a slave race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you bombed the building. The infected firemen, the boy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine our surprise when they began to gestate. My group has been working cooperatively with the alien colonists, facilitating their programs. To give us access to the virus. In false hope we might be able to secretly find a cure. So that we might save ourselves, as the last of the species. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father wisely refused to believe this, choosing hope over selfishness. Hope is the only future he had: his children, (beat, then self-revealing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only future any of us have. This draws a look back in the mirror from the Driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... he sacrificed his own daughter. My sister, Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only true survivors of the viral holocaust will be those immune to it: those vaccinated against it and human/alien hybrids. Your father arranged for your sister's abduction. He allowed her to be taken to an alien hybrid program, so that she would survive. As a clone. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had different hopes for you. That you would uncover the truth about the Project. That you would stop it. That you would fight the future. Mulder sits stunned by this. As if somehow his destiny has been validated, if not pre-ordained. Or maybe just justified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it only fair you should know, given how hard you've worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Kurtzweil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As your father knew, things need to be sacrificed to the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kurtzweil is in the trunk. Mulder stares at the W.M.M., at his cold-blooded expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out. Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver. Mulder reaching to this as the limo pulls to a stop. Trying the door, but the door is locked. When he turns back to the W.M.M. he has produced a handgun, which is now pointing at Mulder. Laid casually across a folded arm. Mulder reacts on seeing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men I work with will stop at nothing to clear the way for what they believe is their stake in the inevitable future. I was ordered to kill Kurtzweil. A necessary action to protect my grandchildren's lives. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might just as easily kill you. Mulder is recoiling as he says this. Then, without hesitation in one quick move, he SHOOTS the Driver in the head. The blood spattering on the front windshield -- and on Mulder who has barely had a chance to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust no one, Mr. Mulder. Mulder looks at The Well-Manicured Man, expecting to be next. And for a moment, we do too. But the W.M.M. simply opens the door and steps out of the car. Holding the door open for Mulder who is still frozen by the actions that went just before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder steps out of the car, holding the felt envelope. The Well-Manicured Man stands with a sober, intense look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with quiet force)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have precious little time. What I've given you the alien colonists have no idea exists. You hold in your hand the power to end the project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vaccine you hold is the only defense against the virus. Its introduction into an alien environment may have the power to destroy the delicate plans we've so assiduously protected for the last fifty years. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or it may not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What alien environment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Agent Scully. Save her. Only her science can save the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is over. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Mulder stands speechless for a moment. Until the W.M.M. points the weapon he's still holding at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go now! And Mulder does. Moving away from the car, looking back over his shoulder. As the Well-Manicured Man gets back into the limousine, closes the door. A moment later... THE CAR EXPLODES INTO FLAMES, knocking Mulder to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: The felt envelope has been jarred from his grasp. Its contents loosed from inside: a piece of paper with COORDINATES on it and an AMPULE and SYRINGE. Mulder gets up, looks back. Then he picks up the envelope and its contents -- and begins to run. Running as fast as he can go. Until, far down the block, he disappears. As the SCREEN DISSOLVES TO WHITENESS -- under which we hear an ominous low end Dolby THX Big Screen rumble. The same sound that opened our story. Then there is movement, as the curvilinear line of a horizon becomes visible, bi-secting the screen between the white of the earth and the white of the sky. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the expanse of whiteness, a DARK IMAGE appears on the long flat horizon. Moving toward us. As a LEGEND appears, to establish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawling across the harsh frozen land like a domed insect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder sits behind the controls of the enclosed cabin, several days growth on his face. Dressed in thick, bundled outerwear. He maneuvers the vehicle to a stop. Reaching for a handheld GPS monitor to check his position. Catching his breath for a moment -- all movement is exertion in this climate. Mulder stares hard out the front window, the wipers beating time, but there is nothing out there but whiteness. He wipes the fog from a side window with his gloved hand, seeing nothing but more whiteness. Checking the GPS device again, then reaching for the door latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mulder exits the vehicle, hopping down onto the snowscape crust. Setting out on foot with the GPS device held before him. In this forbidding environment he might as well be taking a space walk -- without the security of a lifeline. Which is the impression we get as his tiny figure trudges across the ice, increasing the distance between himself and the snow tractor.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: Up a gentle grade, the snow tractor now behind him. Moving into tight f.g. where he stops, seeing something now which allows him to pocket the GPS device. Dropping instinctively to his knees, so as to avoid being seen by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance is an ICE STATION. A row of interconnecting WHITE DOME TENTS, whose design is now familiar to us. There are what look like snow tractors and other snow vehicles parked alongside the structures.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER
dialogues.text: Pulling a compact pair of binoculars from one of his deep jacket pockets. Training them on:

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE STATION
dialogues.text: PANNING across the domes and vehicles, where there is no sign of personnel -- until MULDER PANS off the building, finding in his field glasses AN APPROACHING SNOW TRACTOR. Moving across the landscape toward the ice station. When it pulls to a stop, A MAN exits out of one of the domes: THE CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN. Moving to the vehicle and getting in. The vehicle reverses now, transporting the CSM back away from the ice station.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: Taking the field glasses away from his eyes. The excitement he feels expressed now in his breathing, which has become harder and shallower. Mulder rises, beginning to move the still great distance between himself and the ice station.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: Mulder moving slowly across the white horizon toward the domed tents.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER'S FEET
dialogues.text: Moving cautiously, and with effort on the snowscape crust. CAMERA RISING up to Mulder's face, determined and watchful.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING MULDER
dialogues.text: The ice station still several hundred yards in the distance, when MULDER SUDDENLY FALLS OUT OF FRAME, disappearing into a hole in the snowscape crust that just moments earlier had been stable footing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Mulder's body falls through a ceiling of snowscape crust, landing on his back with a THUD on a hard surface. It takes him a moment to catch his breath, somewhat reminiscent of Stevie at the beginning of the picture. Wincing through the pain. Until he turns over, regaining his wits, and his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder has fallen on a hard, narrow metallic structure. Its dull black color a stark contrast to the white ice it's encased in. The bubble has been created by air coming out of vents in the structure, carving out corresponding patterns in the ceiling; softening the ice and snow above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rising to his knees, the AIR from one of these vents blowing onto his face. Pulling off the hood of his jacket, looking deep into the vent which is open, ungrated. And big enough for a man to crawl into. Which, after considering the hole he's fallen through high above him, is really Mulder's only choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulder pulls himself forward through the ribbed corridor duct with his elbows, moving lizard-like into the constricted darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above a frozen ice lith, Mulder's head appears, squeezing his shoulders and body out of a venting. With effort, Mulder slides out of the small space, using some architecture above as a handhold. Pulling his legs free and dropping onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark in here, the features of the corridor ill-defined.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MULDER
dialogues.text: Mulder pulls a flashlight from a pocket in his parka, snicks it on. Its beam reflecting off tall frozen liths of ice regularly spaced on both sides of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: MULDER
dialogues.text: Training the light down the corridor, which curves away in both directions. Then pointing it at something right in front of his nose: something that gives him a start.
